title: Fed-up employees, NFT land grab, and Prince Harry’s unicorn
paragraph: We gather numbers to know from the week’s biggest economic news stories so you can impress yourself and your friends.
label: business

title: Dislodging Suez Canal ship said to need at least a week
paragraph: It could take weeks to free Ever Given ship if cargo needs to be unloaded or extensive repairs made to the canal itself.
label: business

title: NFT craze: Why are non-fungible tokens all the rage?
paragraph: Explaining the popularity of digital art with ownership recorded on blockchain and purchased in cryptocurrency.
label: business

title: WeWork revives plans to go public, this time with a SPAC deal
paragraph: Valued as high as $47bn two years ago, WeWork will try to go public again through a SPAC merger that values it at $9bn.
label: business

title: Virtual land and spaceships: NFTs and the new crypto frontier
paragraph: A new twist on the American dream is taking root in virtual worlds, where investors buy parcels of land.
label: business

title: Sudan to access $2BN in World Bank grants after settling debts
paragraph: The arrears, dating back to the days of President Omar al-Bashir, were cleared via a $1.15bn bridge loan from the US.
label: business

title: US: Dominion Voting sues Fox News for defamation
paragraph: The voting systems company says it was subject of a misinformation campaign by Trump and allies over the 2020 election.
label: business

title: Houthis launch attacks on Saudi oil facilities, military sites
paragraph: Yemen’s Houthis launch drone and missile attacks on Aramco facilities on the sixth anniversary of Saudi intervention.
label: business

title: Fears of prolonged Suez Canal blockage drive oil prices higher
paragraph: Salvage firm says giant ship blocking Suez Canal, among busiest channels for oil and fuels, could take weeks to free.
label: business

title: Emerging economies delay clean energy move as oil prices rise
paragraph: Large economies have pledged at least $292bn in COVID relief for fossil-fuel intensive industries, researchers say.
label: business

title: Africa-bound: Ships set for costly detour amid Suez blockage
paragraph: Shippers are concerned that a vessel blocking the Suez Canal could take weeks to dislodge.
label: business

title: US Congress piles pressure on Big Tech CEOs over misinformation
paragraph: Twitter’s Dorsey takes some responsibility for Capitol Hill riot, while Facebook’s and Alphabet’s chiefs deflect blame.
label: business

title: Nigeria’s crackdown on Bitcoin echoes global crypto conundrum
paragraph: Governments around the world are grappling with how to regulate cryptocurrencies without stifling crypto innovations.
label: business

title: China targets UK politicians for sanctions over Xinjiang ‘lies’
paragraph: Foreign ministry says nine individuals and four groups subject to immediate sanctions and threatens further action.
label: business

title: New attempt to refloat ship blocking Suez Canal fails: Live
paragraph: Bernhard Schulte Shipmanagement confirmed that two additional tugs would arrive on March 28.
label: business

title: What Joe Biden said in his first presidential press conference
paragraph: The US president takes questions from reporters on issues including migration, China, COVID vaccines and voting rights.
label: business

title: SPAC slump: ‘Blank check’ stocks dip on reports of SEC inquiry
paragraph: The reason SPACs are known as ‘blank check’ firms is that they generally don’t have a merger target when they’re formed.
label: business

title: Bitcoin selloff takes a bite out of cryptocurrency’s biggest fund
paragraph: The $29.4 billion Grayscale Bitcoin Trust dropped about 20% so far this week as the retail-driven crypto craze cools.
label: business

title: Is liftoff of Cathie Wood’s new ARK Space ETF imminent?
paragraph: Ark Investment Management’s new space ETF could debut as soon as the start of next week, based on regulatory filings.
label: business

title: Myanmar military’s giant conglomerates sanctioned by US, UK
paragraph: Thursday’s sanctions are the most significant yet against the wide-ranging business interests of Myanmar’s military.
label: business

title: WWII codebreaker Alan Turing honoured on new UK bank note
paragraph: Turing was a mathematician and is considered the father of modern computing.
label: business

title: India’s massive coal mines auction sends mixed climate signals

label: business

paragraph: ‘It was time to get in the boats and protect the people, not check the inspection records,’ the Fed’s Chairman said.
label: business

paragraph: Rebels invaded the town of Palma, the hub of a giant gas project, as violence continues in the troubled region.
label: business

paragraph: The number of Americans seeking unemployment benefits fell sharply last week to 684,00 from 781,000 the week before.
label: business

paragraph: ‘I’m so excited about people’s response to new technologies like robotics,’ Sophia told Reuters news agency.
label: business

label: business

label: business
